newsitem.title: JAPAN: Kawasho withdraws from Indonesian cement venture.
newsitem.headline: Kawasho withdraws from Indonesian cement venture.

text.p: Japanese steel trader Kawasho Corp said on Wednesday that it had pulled out of its cement venture in Indonesia with PT Indocement Tunggal Prakarsa.
Kawasho withdrew from PT Indo Clean Set Cement, a cement producer, after reviewing the venture's business, Kawasho said in a statement.
It did not give a reason for the withdrawal.

Kawasho expects to post an extraordinary loss of 152 million yen in the six months to September 30, 1996, due to the pull-out, but that would not have an impact on its half-year net profit forecast, it said.
Kawasho is owned 24.7 percent by Kawasaki Steel Corp.
